newsitem.title: COTE D'IVOIRE: Ivorians invite bids for state shipping line.
newsitem.headline: Ivorians invite bids for state shipping line.

text.p: Ivory Coast on Tuesday invited private bids for a 52 percent share in the state shipping agency SISA (Sitram International Shipping Agencies) as part of a wider privatisation programme.

"The tender is for the sale to a private operator of 52 percent of the capital of SISA held by the state of Cote d'Ivoire," Ivory Coast's privatisation Committee said in a statement in the government daily Fraternite Matin.
Bids should be submitted by a July 3 deadline and would be considered valid for 90 days. A list of bidders would be announced on July 4, the statement said.
